results.title: Seeing through commercials
results.creator_credit: Barr Films, Larry Stein and Ruth Arens
results.brief_description: Designed to alert younger children to the techniques and motivations behind television commercials. Shows how close-up shots, camera angles, lighting and special effects can make products seem bigger and more exciting than they really are, and points out how the narration in commercials can be misleading. Also notes how important product information and disclaimers are often included very briefly and subtly at the end of a commercial. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Seeing red: stories of American communists
results.creator_credit: Heartland Productions, Julia Reichert and James Klein
results.brief_description: Compelling Academy Award-nominated documentary providing an oral history account of the American Communist Party from the Great Depression, through McCarthyist demonisation of the 50s, to the early 80s. Employing a wealth of archival material culled from over 400 interview sessions with former and current party members, the film provides a vernacular account of the American Left. Includes footage of speeches made by Ronald Reagan, Richard Nixon, Hubert Humphrey and Joseph McCarthy set the context for the film. The film provides a fascinating vernacular account of the American Left.

results.title: Seeing red and feeling blue
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and Jane Oehr
results.brief_description: Provides basic information about reproduction and aspects of menstruation, and probes emotional responses on many aspects of womanhood. The Women’s Theatre Group of Melbourne performs improvisations and satirical sketches which comment on many of society’s prevailing attitudes towards sex education and women.

results.title: Seeing It Our Way
results.brief_description: A sensitive program which gives viewers an insight into the daily lives of visually impaired people and shows how best to assist such people, especially the elderly. Simulated vision segments give viewers a true appreciation of what it is like to be visually impaired. The program covers hazards, clothes and storage, communication issues and myths, “sighted guide” techniques and more.

results.title: Seeing by numbers
results.creator_credit: London Television Service, Bob Thorpe and Janice Kay
results.brief_description: Presents the history of information from the 13th century and the new ways we can communicate. Shows everyday applications of numerical analysis in such areas as weather forecasting, telephone information systems, education and business.

results.title: Seeing a sound
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Jane Passy, a speech therapist, explains how valuable her system of cued articulation can be in primary education in helping children to learn the consonant sounds of the English language. The method involves hand movements to demonstrate the physical actions of speech.

results.title: Seeds of violence
results.brief_description: Examines the causes of violence and destruction and shows how violence operates in a cycle which in turn stimulates retaliation and revenge. Shows how the violent urge exists in childhood as well as adulthood, focusing on bullying in the schoolground and male to female violence in teenagers - both verbal and physical abuse. Covers the topic of boredom as the reason for violent destructive behaviour. Contains some animated scenes. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Seeds of revolution = Semillas de revolucion
results.creator_credit: ABC Television (US), Howard Enders Productions and Howard Enders
results.brief_description: A documentary about the economic and social injustice in Hondouras. The present co-operation between the military government and the Standard Fruit Company is seen in the historical framework of class oppression and exploitation that may only be able to find its resolution through revolution.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ABC Television (US), Howard Enders Productions and Howard Enders

results.title: Seeds of discovery
results.creator_credit: MRC Films, National Aeronautics and Space Administration and Bert Lawrence
results.brief_description: An introduction to planetary exploration and scientific satellite research considered for the 1970’s. Briefly describes plans for Mariner flybys of Mars, Pioneer studies of Jupiter, landings of unmanned Viking spacecraft on Mars, a grand tour of the outer planets, and solar and other astronomy research.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.
